It's only Day 2 of school and Ryan Conn is "digging" into his student-service work in the WDC Greenhouse like a pro! The WDC senior is a BIG help to Caroline Venis, greenhouse caretaker. Grades 5-12 students/families

When you get to the school you will grab your breakfast and report to 1st hour after you have dropped your stuff off at your lockers.

Just remember that we expect you to wear your masks at all times in the building, and we will be doing our best with social distancing.

Terry Olson talks about his daughter Johanna and her love of running.

WDC's Johanna Olson Cross Country Meet honors Terry Olson and Jane Bagstad's daughter, who was a Wadena-Deer Creek High School graduate, as well as a former NCAA Division III cross country champion and two-time U.S. Olympic Marathon Trials qualifier. She died at the of age 33 on Jan. 3, 2013 after a 15-year battle with recurring brain cancer. WDC now honors her at their first Cross Country meet at Wadena each year.

Wadena-Deer Creek JV/JH girls tennis team hosted the Osakis Silverstreaks yesterday. No official results, but head coach Jordan Cresap, was pleased with the efforts of the student-athletes:

"Our JV and Junior High kids played very well yesterday against Osakis. Osakis has a traditionally strong tennis program so it was fun to see our kids compete well with them. We won a majority of the matches and our losses were close and competitive. Our girls are staying true to using correct form and technique during match play which is very encouraging to see. Their hard work and willingness to be coached is paying off with great improvement!"

🎉🎉WELCOME, NEW TEACHER ... Rebecca Frosig🎉🎉

WDC is excited to welcome Ms. Rebecca Frosig as our grades 5 and 6 special education teacher. Rebecca will be learning from Connie Mosher, who will be retiring from teaching in October. Let's give Rebecca a warm Wolverine welcome to our school and community!

More fun facts about Rebecca:

Hometown and High School: Cloquet, Minn., and a Cloquet Senior High School graduate.

College/Years Teaching: University of Minnesota-Duluth. This will be my sixth year of teaching.

Pastimes: Spending time outdoors, kayaking, and reading.

Family/Pets: Boyfriend, Jason, and dog, Jade (pictured here). I'm also getting a puppy this week!

Best advice you’ve ever received: "If at first you don’t succeed, try again!"

What do you love about teaching: "Building relationships with students and staff."

Something unique about yourself: "I have lived and taught in Europe for two months."

What is your dream superpower: "Flying!"

Welcome to Wolverine family, Rebecca! Glad to have you on our team!

#WolverinePride

Sometimes teachers and staff can be just as rambunctious as kids when it comes to taking a photo.😁

This was one of those times on Oct. 12, 2010 when we gathered the high school staff in front of the tornado-damaged school. But considering the times (the tornado hit June 17, 2010), we were all a bit dazed and crazed!

Some of us in this photo are still here, some have moved on or retired, and some have left this world.💙💛

It's good to remember and never forget our Wolverine family.#TakeMeBackTuesday

There will be no formal gathering, but groups can sign up for a tee time and submit their "best ball" 18-hole scramble score to compete for the Wolverine Trophy and bragging rights for 2020. All participants will receive a small gift, as well as a chance to win prizes.

Cost for the day is $50 for non-members of Whitetail Run and $20 for members -- $20 of the registration goes to Wolverine Athletics and cost includes 18 holes and a cart.

Call Whitetail Run Golf Course at (218) 631-7718 for your tee time. Make sure to say you want to participate in the "Wolverine Day" celebration. Get your foursome together and have a great time golfing!

Thank you for all of your support of Wolverine Athletics!

We are STRONGER TOGETHER!

UPDATE ON PAIGE KILBURY
WDC senior Paige Kilbury is back in the hospital fighting an infection, according to her dad, Chad.

In a message this morning, 7/10, he writes:

“She’s doing as good as she can, she is in a lot of pain still as it is to be expected. But she’s a fighter, that’s for sure!”

Paige received her liver transplant on June 20, 2020. She had been on life support for eight days prior to the transplant.

When Paige does get released from the hospital, hopefully today, she will go to back to the Ronald McDonald House. Paige and her mom will be there for a month “to make sure Paige’s meds are tweeked just right and to see if her new liver has any rejection issues,” he said.

Please continue to keep Paige and her family in your thoughts and prayers. She has a long road ahead of her.

A fundraiser has been set up by Amy Kine to help with medical expenses.

On Tuesday, May 26, the Eligibility Committee of the MN State High School League's Board of Directors passed a motion to amend the 2020 Summer Coaching Waiver Period. The motion recommends the change of the start date of the summer coaching waiver period to Monday, June 15, 2020.

According to WDC Activities Director Norm Gallant, what this means is that WDC cannot schedule any kind of summer athletic activities for our athletes until June 15.

"Our coaches may not work with our student-athletes until that time. We will continue to offer information for the kids and reach out to maintain positive relationships and support. Our end goal is to follow the guidance of the MSHSL and find a way to get our activities and workouts going as soon as possible," said Gallant.

Thank you for your patience and cooperation!
